marketNews.title: OPEC+ to postpone planned production increase
marketNews.content: The OPEC+ delegation said the organization is getting closer to an agreement to postpone the planned increase in oil production by 180,000 barrels per day (bpd) for three months, which was originally scheduled to start in January 2025. The plan is an effort by OPEC+ to maintain oil supply as oil prices (Brent) remain weak, hovering around US$70 per barrel (down 2.5% YTD). Brent even fell below US$70 per barrel in September (10/9), marking the lowest level since the end of 2023. A formal decision is scheduled for Thursday (5/12). OPEC+ has undertaken various measures to support oil prices. In total, OPEC+ has cut production by 5.86 million bpd – equivalent to 5.7% of global demand – since 2022. The cuts consist of voluntary cuts of 2.2 million bpd and mandatory cuts of 3.66 million bpd. Initially, OPEC+ planned to start phasing out voluntary cuts in October 2024, but this was postponed for two months, until December 2024, due to weakening oil prices. Despite the postponement, total OPEC+ production is still expected to rise in 2025. In June 2024, OPEC+ agreed on a production increase for the United Arab Emirates (UAE) of 300,000 bpd gradually starting January 2025. Additionally, Kazakhstan plans to expand the Tengiz oil field, potentially boosting its oil output. Following the production postponement news, Brent strengthened by more than 2% on Tuesday (3/12) and edged up another 0.2% toward US$74 per barrel today (4/12). Driven by this positive sentiment, the shares of oil producers such as $MEDC (+5.6%) and $ENRG (+3.4%) rose today.

marketNews.title: Indonesia to raise VAT to 12% from Jan 2025
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said on Tuesday (3/11) that the government will confirm next week an increase in the value-added tax (VAT) rate from 11% to 12%. If implemented, the VAT hike will take effect on 1 January 2025. Previously, business groups and labor unions had called for a postponement of the VAT increase, citing a deteriorating economy. In addition to the VAT hike, Airlangga said the government will announce fiscal stimulus to support labor-intensive industries, which have been hit by a wave of layoffs due to slowing global demand.

marketNews.title: Indonesia expects $1bn Apple investment to produce iPhone 16
marketNews.content: Investment Minister Rosan Roeslani said that the government has received an investment offer of US$1 billion from Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL), as part of the tech giant's latest effort to sell the iPhone 16 in Indonesia. The amount is 100 times larger than Apple's initial investment offer of US$10 million in early November 2024, and follows the government's rejection of a US$100 million investment offer last week. Rosan said the government hopes to obtain a commitment letter within one week. Previously, Industry Minister Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita said in November 2024 that his top priority was to get Apple to open a factory in Indonesia, similar to other smartphone manufacturers such as Samsung Electronics Co. and Xiaomi Corp.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia ready to intervene to support rupiah near 16,000 per USD
marketNews.content: The head of the Monetary Management and Securities Asset Department at Bank Indonesia, Edi Susianto, said on Wednesday (4/11) that the central bank is ready to intervene in the foreign exchange market to stabilize the rupiah, which is currently approaching the psychological level of IDR 16,000 per US dollar. The comment came after the rupiah weakened by 0.2% to IDR 15,968 at the start of trading on Wednesday (4/11), underperforming other Asian currencies. The rupiah has approached the IDR 16,000 level for the second time in the past month. Bank Indonesia previously said that the fundamental level of the rupiah is stronger than IDR 16,000 per US dollar.

marketNews.title: EU delays anti-deforestation law implementation to Dec 30 2025
marketNews.content: The European Union on Tuesday (3/11) approved a 12-month postponement of the implementation of its anti-deforestation law to 30 December 2025, without changing the substance of the regulation. Previously, Bloomberg reported in November 2024 that the European Parliament had proposed further changes to make the regulation softer. The EU anti-deforestation regulation is a milestone in the fight against the climate crisis, but developing countries such as Brazil and Indonesia say the rule is protectionist. The EU is Indonesia's fourth-largest export market and accounts for 11.5% of total Indonesian CPO exports in 2023.

marketNews.title: China bans export of critical minerals to the US
marketNews.content: China's Ministry of Commerce announced on Tuesday (3/11) a ban on the export of several critical minerals to the United States, including gallium, germanium, antimony, and superhard materials. The Chinese government also said it will impose stricter controls on graphite exports to the US. The move follows the US earlier this week restricting the sale of high-bandwidth memory chips to China to slow its semiconductor and artificial intelligence development that could aid its military.

marketNews.title: Indonesia launches auction of six oil and gas blocks
marketNews.content: Indonesia's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources launched an auction for six oil and gas blocks on Tuesday (3/11), bringing the total number of blocks offered in 2024 to 11. The blocks offered are Air Komering, Serpang, Kojo, Binaiya, Gaea, and Gaea II, with a total estimated reserve of 48 billion barrels of oil equivalent. The government aims to boost oil and gas exploration to discover new hydrocarbon reserves amid declining production from older fields.

marketNews.title: Indonesia to release protected forest area in Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua project
marketNews.content: The Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Susiwijono Moegiarso, said on Tuesday (4/11) that the ministry will soon implement the release of protected forest status for land included in the National Strategic Project (PSN) Tropical Coastland owned by Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua ($PANI). Previously, the Minister of Agrarian Affairs and Spatial Planning/Head of the National Land Agency, Nusron Wahid, noted that the PSN Tropical Coastland project faces several issues, one of which is that 1,500 hectares of the total ~1,700 hectares are protected forest. Susiwijono also said the ministry will facilitate discussions between the Ministry of Forestry and PANI to address the matter.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Stock Exchange to set auto-rejection rules for corporate warrants
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) will issue regulations on auto-rejection for corporate warrants. Currently, auto-rejection occurs when the offer price for buying or selling a warrant entered into JAST equals or exceeds the last trade price of the underlying stock. The new rules will set thresholds: 1) warrant price equal to or above the underlying's last trade price; 2) more than IDR 10 for warrants priced IDR 1-9 per share; 3) more than 50% above or below the reference price for warrants priced IDR 10-200 per share; 4) more than 40% above or below the reference price for warrants priced IDR 200-5,000 per share; and 5) more than 30% above or below the reference price for warrants priced above IDR 5,000 per share. BEI has not announced when the new regulations will take effect.

tickerNews.title: EXCL CEO resigns ahead of merger with FREN
tickerNews.content: $EXCL: XL Axiata announced that Dian Siswarini submitted her resignation as chief executive officer on 3 December 2024. EXCL explained that the resignation was for personal reasons. The resignation will become effective after approval at the shareholders meeting, with the implementation date not yet announced. The resignation occurs amid the company's planned merger with Smartfren Telecom ($FREN), where Dian in October 2024 said the corporate action could be completed by the end of 2024.

tickerNews.title: PTPP sells 99.3% stake in PT Ultra Mandiri Telekomunikasi to MTEL
tickerNews.content: $PTPP: PT PP, through its subsidiary PT PP Infrastruktur, announced that it has sold its entire 99.3% ownership in PT Ultra Mandiri Telekomunikasi for IDR 645.5 billion to Dayamitra Telekomunikasi ($MTEL). The transaction is part of a divestment plan of PT PP assets worth up to IDR 1 trillion in 2024, aimed at reducing the company's long-term debt, which reached IDR 11.31 trillion as of 3Q24. PT Ultra Mandiri Telekomunikasi operates in telecommunications infrastructure, specifically fiber optic.

tickerNews.title: HRUM converts debt to equity in Harum Nickel Industry
tickerNews.content: $HRUM: Harum Energy, through its subsidiary PT Tanito Harum Nickel (THN), announced that it has taken up approximately 4 million newly issued shares of PT Harum Nickel Industry (HNI), the HRUM-controlled nickel mining investment entity. The transaction implements the conversion of all HNI debt to THN amounting to IDR 4.2 trillion (US$266.3 million). After the transaction, THN retains a 99.99% ownership in HNI. The corporate action aims to strengthen HNI's capital structure to realize the company's long-term diversification strategy.

tickerNews.title: TBIG declares interim dividend of 25 IDR per share
tickerNews.content: $TBIG: Tower Bersama Infrastructure will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to IDR 25 per share. The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 11 December 2024, with payment on 27 December 2024. Based on TBIG's closing price on Wednesday (4/11) at IDR 1,945 per share, the implied dividend yield is 1.3%.

tickerNews.title: TPIA director Andre Khor Kah Hin purchases 148,600 shares
tickerNews.content: $TPIA: Director of Chandra Asri Pacific, Andre Khor Kah Hin, bought 148,600 TPIA shares at an average price of IDR 6,733 per share on 28 November 2024. The total transaction value reached IDR 1 billion. After the transaction, Andre Khor Kah Hin's ownership in TPIA increased from zero to 0.00017%.

tickerNews.title: AVIA director Ruslan Tanoko purchases ~8.3 million shares
tickerNews.content: $AVIA: Director of Avia Avian, Ruslan Tanoko, bought approximately 8.3 million AVIA shares at an average price of IDR 422 per share on 26 November 2024. The total transaction value reached IDR 3.5 billion. After the transaction, Ruslan's ownership in AVIA increased from 0.0474% to 0.0609%.

tickerNews.title: EAST declares interim dividend of 3.5 IDR per share
tickerNews.content: $EAST: Eastparc Hotel will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to IDR 3.5 per share (total IDR 14.4 billion). The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 12 December 2024, with payment on 27 December 2024. Based on EAST's closing price on Wednesday (4/11) at IDR 110 per share, the implied dividend yield is 3.2%. This is the third interim dividend for EAST after an interim dividend of IDR 1.5 per share in June 2024 and IDR 1.25 per share in October 2024.

tickerNews.title: BREN declares interim dividend of 3.78 IDR per share
tickerNews.content: $BREN: Barito Renewables Energy will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to IDR 3.78 per share (total IDR 506.2 billion). The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 11 December 2024, with payment on 20 December 2024. Based on BREN's closing price on Wednesday (4/11) at IDR 7,475 per share, the implied dividend yield is 0.05%.
